lines.text: Tax Survey Questions
1. Thinking about the state of Maryland, do you feel that things are generally moving in
the right direction, or have they gotten off on the wrong track?
2. I am going to read to you a list of issues facing the state of Maryland, please tell me
which one you feel is most important to you? (Rotate choices)
Crime
Taxes
Education
Jobs/economy
Health Care
Environment
Government spending
Tobacco/Smoking
3. Do you believe the amount you pay to the state government in taxes is very fair,
somewhat fair, somewhat unfair, or very unfair?
4. Approximately, what percentage of the money you pay in state taxes is wasted by the
government?
Now, thinking about tax increases...
5. Would you favor or oppose legislation to increase revenue through a tax increase on
tobacco products?
6.If your state representative voted to increase taxes, how confident are you that they
will spend the revenue wisely?
7.In your mind is it fair to single out one segment of taxpayers to pay for statewide
programs like education and health care?
Now I am going to read to you a list of statements dealing with state spending
and tax increases. After I read the following statements, please tell me whether
you agree or disagree with the statement. (Rotate questions 8-15)
8. "If the government wants to fund public programs, it would be better for politicians to
eliminate wasteful spending and manage programs more efficiently than to raise the
tax on tobacco products"?
9. "The state government needs to be more accountable for the revenue it currently takes
in before a tax increase on cigarettes is proposed'"?

full_text:
Tax Survey Questions
1. Thinking about the state of Maryland, do you feel that things are generally moving in
the right direction, or have they gotten off on the wrong track?
2. I am going to read to you a list of issues facing the state of Maryland, please tell me
which one you feel is most important to you? (Rotate choices)
Crime
Taxes
Education
Jobs/economy
Health Care
Environment
Government spending
Tobacco/Smoking
3. Do you believe the amount you pay to the state government in taxes is very fair,
somewhat fair, somewhat unfair, or very unfair?
4. Approximately, what percentage of the money you pay in state taxes is wasted by the
government?
Now, thinking about tax increases...
5. Would you favor or oppose legislation to increase revenue through a tax increase on
tobacco products?
6.If your state representative voted to increase taxes, how confident are you that they
will spend the revenue wisely?
7.In your mind is it fair to single out one segment of taxpayers to pay for statewide
programs like education and health care?
Now I am going to read to you a list of statements dealing with state spending
and tax increases. After I read the following statements, please tell me whether
2078283977
you agree or disagree with the statement. (Rotate questions 8-15)
8. "If the government wants to fund public programs, it would be better for politicians to
eliminate wasteful spending and manage programs more efficiently than to raise the
tax on tobacco products"?
9. "The state government needs to be more accountable for the revenue it currently takes
in before a tax increase on cigarettes is proposed'"?
